subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Scientology: Religion or Business?
description: A fast breakdown of Scientology: Religion or Business? for builders.

hook.text: Founded by a sci-fi writer, Scientology charges thousands for spiritual advancement. Is it a religion or a business?

buildup.text: L. Ron Hubbard created Scientology in 1954. It promises spiritual freedom through a system called 'auditing.'

discovery.text: The IRS granted it tax-exempt religious status in 1993 after a massive legal battle. Recognition was won, not given.

twist.text: Former members describe abuse, surveillance, and financial exploitation. Scientology sues critics aggressively.

climax.text: Scientology tests what counts as a religion. If belief is sincere, does it matter if the founder was a fiction writer?

punchline.text: A fiction writer founded a religion. Sincerity is hard to measure from outside.

quiz.question: What makes Scientology controversial?
options: Allegations of financial exploitation, abuse, and aggressive legal action against critics
